zh-cn: 格奥尔格·奥古斯特·哥廷根大学

description.zh-cn: 位于德国西北部下萨克森州南端哥廷根市的公立研究型大学，由英国国王兼汉诺威选帝侯格奥尔格二世创建。
description.en: A public research university in the city of Göttingen, Lower Saxony, in northwestern Germany, founded by King George II of Great Britain and Elector of Hanover.

description.zh-cn: 英国国王及汉诺威选帝侯，哥廷根大学与哥廷根科学院的创办者。
description.en: King of Great Britain and Elector of Hanover, founder of the University of Göttingen and the Göttingen Academy of Sciences.

nodes.id: 格拉克·阿道夫·冯·明希豪森

zh-cn: 格拉克·阿道夫·冯·明希豪森

description.zh-cn: 汉诺威选侯国重臣，受乔治二世委派创办哥廷根大学，并成为首任校长。
description.en: A privy councillor of the Electorate of Hanover, commissioned by George II to establish the University of Göttingen and served as its first curator.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲的一场知识及文化运动，强调理性、个人主义和科学方法。哥廷根大学的创建旨在弘扬其学术自由的理念。
description.en: An intellectual and cultural movement in Europe that emphasized reason, individualism, and the scientific method. The University of Göttingen was founded to promote its ideal of academic freedom.

description.zh-cn: 法国军事家、政治家，法兰西第一帝国皇帝，曾在哥廷根大学研习法律。
description.en: A French military and political leader and Emperor of the French, who studied law at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪德国著名国家法学大师，曾在哥廷根大学执教半个世纪。
description.en: A famous 18th-century German master of public law who taught at the University of Göttingen for half a century.

description.zh-cn: 奥地利首相，曾在哥廷根大学师从法学家皮特。
description.en: Austrian Chancellor, who studied under the jurist Pütter at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 著名教育家，柏林大学创办人，曾在哥廷根大学师从法学家皮特。
description.en: A renowned educator and founder of the University of Berlin, who studied under the jurist Pütter at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 哥廷根大学的七名教授因反对汉诺威国王废除宪法而被驱逐的事件。
description.en: An event in which seven professors from the University of Göttingen were expelled for protesting against the King of Hanover's abrogation of the constitution.

description.zh-cn: 汉诺威国王，因其废除宪法之举引发了“哥廷根七君子事件”。
description.en: King of Hanover, whose abrogation of the constitution led to the 'Göttingen Seven' incident.

description.zh-cn: 德国作家、语言学家，曾在哥廷根大学任教，因哥廷根七君子事件被驱逐。
description.en: German authors and linguists who were professors at the University of Göttingen and were expelled as part of the Göttingen Seven incident.

description.zh-cn: 德国数学家，被誉为“数学王子”，曾是哥廷根大学的学生和教授。
description.en: German mathematician, known as the 'Prince of Mathematicians', who was a student and professor at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 德国数学家，现代数学之父，在担任哥廷根大学教授期间将哥廷根缔造成世界数学中心。
description.en: German mathematician, considered the father of modern mathematics, who, as a professor, established Göttingen as the world's leading center for mathematics.

description.zh-cn: 1933年至1945年期间由阿道夫·希特勒和纳粹党统治下的德国。其政策导致哥廷根大学大批犹太学者流失，学术地位受到重创。
description.en: Germany between 1933 and 1945 under the rule of Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party. Its policies led to an exodus of Jewish scholars from the University of Göttingen, severely damaging its academic standing.

nodes.id: 职业公务员制度恢复法

zh-cn: 职业公务员制度恢复法
en: Law for the Restoration of the Professional Civil Service

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国颁布的法律，用于清洗公务员队伍中的犹太人及政治反对派，对哥廷根大学的师资力量造成了严重打击。
description.en: A law enacted by Nazi Germany to purge Jews and political opponents from the civil service, which severely impacted the faculty of the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 德国物理学家，1954年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，哥廷根大学博士、教授，后因纳粹迫害而离开。
description.en: German physicist and Nobel laureate in Physics in 1954, who was a PhD and professor at the University of Göttingen before being forced to leave due to Nazi persecution.

description.zh-cn: 德国物理学家，1925年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，哥廷根大学学生、教授，后因纳粹迫害而离开。
description.en: German physicist and Nobel laureate in Physics in 1925, who was a student and professor at the University of Göttingen before being forced to leave due to Nazi persecution.

description.zh-cn: 美国物理学家，“原子弹之父”，在哥廷根大学获得博士学位。后因纳粹迫害犹太学者而离开。
description.en: American physicist, known as the 'father of the atomic bomb', who received his PhD from the University of Göttingen. He later left due to the Nazi persecution of Jewish scholars.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国时期的教育部长。
description.en: Minister of Education during the Nazi Germany era.

en: Göttingen Academy of Sciences and Humanities

description.zh-cn: 由英王乔治二世建立的独立学术机构，与哥廷根大学保持着紧密的合作关系。
description.en: An independent academic institution established by King George II of Great Britain, which maintains a close cooperative relationship with the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 德国的科研机构网络，在哥廷根设有五个研究所，与哥廷根大学有紧密合作关系。
description.en: A network of research institutes in Germany. Five institutes are located in Göttingen and collaborate closely with the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国南京的大学，与哥廷根大学有密切的合作关系，合办了多个研究所。
description.en: A university located in Nanjing, China, which has a close cooperative relationship with the University of Göttingen, jointly establishing several research institutes.

description.zh-cn: 中国语言学家、翻译家、学者，曾在哥廷根大学获得博士学位。
description.en: Chinese linguist, translator, and scholar, who obtained his PhD from the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 台湾法学家，曾任司法院院长，在哥廷根大学获得法学博士学位。
description.en: Taiwanese jurist, former President of the Judicial Yuan, who obtained a Doctor of Law degree from the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 美国金融家，摩根家族代表人物，曾在哥廷根大学学习。
description.en: American financier and a representative figure of the Morgan family, who studied at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 德意志帝国首任宰相，曾在哥廷根大学学习法律。
description.en: The first Chancellor of the German Empire, who studied law at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 作为英国国王及汉诺威选帝侯，乔治二世决定在哥廷根创办一所大学。
description.en: As King of Great Britain and Elector of Hanover, George II decided to found a university in Göttingen.

relationships.target: 格拉克·阿道夫·冯·明希豪森

description.zh-cn: 乔治二世委派其重臣格拉克·阿道夫·冯·明希豪森在哥廷根创办大学。
description.en: George II commissioned his privy councillor Gerlach Adolph von Münchhausen to establish the university in Göttingen.

relationships.source: 格拉克·阿道夫·冯·明希豪森

description.zh-cn: 受乔治二世委派创办哥廷根大学，并成为首任校长。
description.en: Was commissioned by George II to establish the University of Göttingen and became its first curator.

description.zh-cn: 哥廷根大学的创建旨在弘扬欧洲启蒙时代学术自由的理念。
description.en: The University of Göttingen was founded with the aim of promoting the Enlightenment ideal of academic freedom.

description.zh-cn: 汉诺威国王恩斯特·奥古斯特一世废除宪法之举引发了哥廷根七君子事件。
description.en: King Ernest Augustus of Hanover's abrogation of the constitution triggered the Göttingen Seven incident.

description.zh-cn: 作为抗议国王废除宪法的七名教授之一，格林兄弟被驱逐出哥廷根大学。
description.en: As two of the seven professors who protested the king's abrogation of the constitution, the Brothers Grimm were expelled from the University of Göttingen.

relationships.source: 职业公务员制度恢复法

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国1933年颁布的《职业公务员制度恢复法》导致哥廷根大学大批犹太籍科学家和学者被迫离开，学术声誉受到重创。
description.en: The 'Law for the Restoration of the Professional Civil Service' enacted by Nazi Germany in 1933 caused a large number of Jewish scientists and scholars to be forced to leave the University of Göttingen, severely damaging its academic reputation.

description.zh-cn: 由于纳粹德国的迫害，马克斯·波恩被迫离开哥廷根大学。
description.en: Due to persecution by Nazi Germany, Max Born was forced to leave the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 由于纳粹德国的迫害，詹姆斯·弗兰克被迫离开哥廷根大学。
description.en: Due to persecution by Nazi Germany, James Franck was forced to leave the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 由于纳粹德国对犹太学者的迫害，罗伯特·奥本海默离开哥廷根。
description.en: Due to Nazi Germany's persecution of Jewish scholars, J. Robert Oppenheimer left Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 1934年，数学家大卫·希尔伯特与时任纳粹教育部长伯恩哈德·鲁斯特共进晚餐时，表示在犹太学者被驱逐后，“哥廷根已经没有数学了”。
description.en: In 1934, mathematician David Hilbert, during a dinner with then-Nazi Education Minister Bernhard Rust, stated that after the expulsion of Jewish scholars, 'Göttingen has no mathematics anymore.'

description.zh-cn: 哥廷根大学同哥廷根科学院一直保持着合作关系。
description.en: The University of Göttingen has always maintained a cooperative relationship with the Göttingen Academy of Sciences.

description.zh-cn: 哥廷根市设有5家马克斯·普朗克研究所，均同哥廷根大学具有学科上的紧密合作关系。
description.en: There are five Max Planck Institutes in the city of Göttingen, all of which have close disciplinary collaborations with the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 哥廷根大学和南京大学有密切的合作关系，合办了多个研究所。
description.en: The University of Göttingen and Nanjing University have a close cooperative relationship and have jointly established several research institutes.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑曾在哥廷根大学研习法律。
description.en: Napoleon studied law at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 德国著名国家法学大师皮特曾在哥廷根大学执教半个世纪。
description.en: The famous German master of public law, Pütter, taught at the University of Göttingen for half a century.

description.zh-cn: 克莱门斯·梅特涅是皮特在哥廷根大学的学生。
description.en: Klemens von Metternich was a student of Pütter at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 威廉·冯·洪堡是皮特在哥廷根大学的学生。
description.en: Wilhelm von Humboldt was a student of Pütter at the University of Göttingen.

description.zh-cn: 格林兄弟曾在哥廷根大学任教，后因哥廷根七君子事件被驱逐。
description.en: The Brothers Grimm taught at the University of Göttingen and were later expelled as part of the Göttingen Seven incident.
